intro: Bergia diacheiron, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It thrives in sandy or rocky coastal environments, often growing in areas with high salinity and strong winds. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in arid conditions. Bergia diacheiron plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
